alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:17PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA AND NORTHEASTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nambe Pueblo, or 9 miles south of Chimayo, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pojoaque, Chimayo, Nambe Lake, Nambe Pueblo, Rio Chiquito, Cundiyo, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Pojoaque Pueblo, Cuyamungue and El Rancho. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
